alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 21 at 7:00PM PST until February 21 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Salton Sea, Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the first Wind Advisory, until 9 PM PST this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 10 AM to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea
